'Tis Hope, whose glowing eye</br>Delusive sparkles with inviting flame;</br>On whose angelic name</br>Th' afflicted call when misery's bane is nigh!</br>Thou balm of wounding care,</br>That wip'st away the tears of heart-felt grief,</br>Affording blest relief;</br>'Tis thine to cheer the dungeon with a smile,</br>And ease the captive's toil,</br>And soothe the dreaded soul-subduing snare!

Be kind, fair daughter of Desire,</br>Thy solace human woes require.</br>Thy smiles are sweeter than the rose,</br>Or any fragrant flow'r that blows;</br>Yea, they possess more sweets in store</br>Than perfumes from Arabia's shore.</br>Beneath thy loosely-waving train,</br>The gifts of peace securely reign;</br>The sorrows of th' afflicted breast</br>Upon thy downy couch find rest.</br>O Nymph, thine auspices impart,</br>Deign to console the drooping heart:</br>Approach, in cheerful garb array'd,</br>With haste approach, thou heavenly maid!</br>And with thy bright, all-gladd'ning ray,</br>Thy balmy influence display,</br>To banish sorrow from the mind,</br>To leave pale-visag'd care behind:</br>And let that phantom, wan Despair,</br>To some sequester'd cave repair;</br>Or to some dark and dreary cell,</br>Where hideous goblins chuse to dwell;</br>Where nightly ghosts frequent the place,</br>Unknown to all of human race.</br>Hence, from 'mong men, thou hated foe,</br>Inhabit with the fiends below!</br>Let them behold thy haggard sight,</br>Secluded from the realms of light!

But hail, blest Hope!  thy beauteous face,</br>Bedeck'd with ev'ry charming grace,</br>Invites my footsteps to thy shrine,</br>To seek thy healing pow'r divine;</br>Thy vital, soothing aid to see,</br>For Nature seeks support in thee,</br>Arm'd with thy shield 'gainst woe and strife,</br>The wise sustain the pains of life;</br>Relying on thy virtuous pow'r,</br>The brave, in Mis'ry's baneful hour,</br>Strongly oppose th' envenom'd dart,</br>Nor let her poniard pierce the heart.

The wretched prisoner's lonely cell,</br>Where hideous gloom and torments dwell,</br>Is cheer'd by thy auspicious ray,</br>Blest harbinger of Freedom's day.</br>Thy smiles alleviate his pains,</br>And ease his limbs from dark Confinement's chains.

O Nymph!  I see thy comely mien,</br>While pow'rful Fancy paints the scene.</br>But, ah!  what dreaded sights appear!</br>What doleful clangors pierce mine ear!</br>Against the rock the bark is lost,</br>See, the wreck floats along the coast!</br>Alas, what piteous cries I hear!</br>What horrid scenes of death appear!</br>The shipwreck'd crew, with struggling hand,</br>Attempt to reach the distant land.</br>The tempest rages more and more:</br>The waves dash loud against the shore!</br>Around the forked lightning spreads,</br>Aetherial thunder rolls above their heads!</br>Yet here thy succour, Hope, is found,</br>Tho' stern Destruction haunts around,</br>They see thy fair inviting hand</br>Benignly pointing to the land.</br>E'en here, thy kind endearing smile</br>Can Fate's approaching pow'r beguile;</br>Inspir'd with thy attractive charms,</br>They beat the surge with pliant arms,</br>Whilst, by its clear resplendent light,</br>Thy torch discovers to their sight</br>A vista thro' the storm of night.</br>
